ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Otosclerosis (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: CT scan revealed a fixed stapes; audiometry shows conductive hearing loss with air-bone gap.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular chain discontinuity (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: CT scan revealed absent malleus and incus; history of cholesteatoma and tympanoplasty.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hypercompliant tympanic membrane (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Tympanometry revealed a Type Ad tympanogram.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds and determine the type and degree of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess middle ear status and tympanic membrane compliance.
To evaluate the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a unilateral, moderately severe conductive hearing loss in the right ear and normal hearing in the left ear. The right ear demonstrates a significant air-bone gap but excellent word recognition ability when amplified, consistent with the history of middle ear pathology. The left ear is audiometrically normal but exhibits a hypercompliant tympanic membrane.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderately severe conductive hearing loss (250-1500 Hz), rising to mild-moderate (2000-4000 Hz), sloping to moderately severe (6000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Normal limits (250-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 57 dB HL, WRS 100% at 85 dB HL. Left ear: SRT 13 dB HL, WRS 100% at 55 dB HL.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Not tested due to previous surgery. Left ear: Hypercompliant (Type Ad).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Left ear: Could not be measured due to artifact from the hypercompliant tympanic membrane.

counseling_actions: Explain the conductive nature of the hearing loss and the intact nerve function in the right ear.
Discuss the excellent prognosis for amplification given the high word recognition scores.
Explain that the hypercompliant tympanic membrane in the left ear is likely a physiological variance.

escalation.rationale_short: For management of otosclerosis and ossicular chain abnormalities identified on CT.

follow_up_plan.objective: Proceed with amplification options or surgical consultation.
